Reviews.Title: “Please refurbish the Adina as it has a great location”
Reviews.Author: Butterstoneman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Adina (ex-Medina) apart-hotel on many occasions; why? Because it is in Surrey Hills with loads of good restaurants; because I get a washing machine to wash my clothes on a long trip; because I can buy local produce and make myself a meal. So what is my grouse? The place feels grubby and tired; the bathroom floor has not been washed; my feet get black if I walk barefoot on the carpet. The frequency of replacement of household items is inconsistent: one face flannel (for 2 guests) one day, none the next. Dishwasher powder one day, none the next. Broadband (for which I pay) Day 1 â€“ none, Day 2 it works fine, Day 3 none. No spare toilet roll so we run out, and so on. There are never any plugs for the basins, neither in the bathroom nor the kitchen. There are no lamps in the sitting room so we are bathed in a cold overhead light reflecting off the mushroom coloured walls. The â€œartâ€� consists of a massive photo of the grubby end of a glacier; cold, slushy, like snow at the beginning of spring. The broken light fitting dangles from the cable out of the bathroom ceiling; the shower diverter sends 2/3rds of the water into the bath; the basin tap is broken. There are archaeological remains screwed into the bathroom and bedroom walls from long vanished fitments. Donâ€™t expect a check out time later than 11.00 unless you pay A$60 per hour. The baggage storage is in the corner of the office so not particularly secure. The Adina is on busy Crown Street, so the traffic noise is significant unless you pay a premium for a courtyard room. So why do I stay here? 1 Washing machine & tumble dryer. 2 My own kitchen dining space. 3 close to decent restaurants and food shops and walking distance from my office. I will come back but please spend some money on the place soon. I reported all the faults shown here so hopefully they will be fixed by the time the next guest arrives.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in all ways”
Reviews.Author: NaiNai38
Reviews.Content: I booked the Adina on line for two reasons: location and price. I knew nothing else about it. I booked it for 3 visitors from the USA who I did not know well at all. Pretty risky! The accommodation with a huge balcony, 2 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms and well equipped kitchen was perfect. The location is ideal for amazing restaurants so nearby as well as ease to see so much of Sydney . The staff were helpful getting taxis and suggestions of places to eat and shop. It was the perfect introduction to Australia .

Reviews.Title: “Superb Experience”
Reviews.Author: Charbz Z
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights, and received spectacular service from reception at check in to check out. The apartment had city views that you would expect to pay a fortune at other hotels, and the I did not even feel I was staying in the one of the busiest cities in the world. The balcony was amazing and the room had everything I needed to make the stay a comfortable one. I highly recommended this accomodation to anyone who likes a home from home, and close to Sydney's best spots including restaurants and party spots.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and handy location”
Reviews.Author: RobbedByCambridge
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when it was the Medina. I loved the hotel but have only been the once, several years ago. The one bedroom suite was nice and stylish, couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: “great area of sydney”
Reviews.Author: tess317
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Adina Feb.2012. The hotel was very clean and rooms included lounge and kitchen area and was suprisingly spacious, only slight moan was it was very business-like in appearance with battleship grey walls, but the best thing is the area it was in was very trendy with great little boutique style shops and lots of good restaurants away from the hustle and bustle of the main shops but still close enough to walk to Darling Harbour-would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Decent base in a great area, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: rjwilln
Reviews.Content: As a family of four adults we based ourselves here for five days. Surry Hills is a fabulous are full of shops, bars and cafes. This is great but at nighttime it is very noisy, especially at weekends, particularly as our room was overlooking some busy spots on Crown Street. THe room itself was modern and spacious with decent furniture and comfy beds. The kitchen was good enough to be self contained but was a bit sparse on kitchen stuff. Two bathrooms between four was great though hoever there were a few niggly issues with the shower door and loose taps. THis is being a bit pedantic but i would say overall it is in need of a bit of attention.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a family”
Reviews.Author: foxtrot-tango
Reviews.Content: We based ourselves here for a week while my husband was working nearby in Surry Hills. We have two small children (aged 3 and 5) so I had initial reservations about being further away from the main tourist sites, but it actually worked very well. Surry Hills is a nice area with lots of shops and cafes, there's a playground just down the road. It's on a bus route direct to circular quay and also to Coogee beach. It's a 10 minute downhill walk to the Central train station (probably quicker without children in tow) though too steep for my children to walk back after a day of sightseeing, so we tended to catch taxis and buses back. Lovely pool for children. Room was great - had a laundry, two bedrooms both with ensuites, great lounge. Kitchen was well equipped - missing some obvious things (e.g. grater) but when I asked for them, they were delievered within 5 mins. This was a fantastic family base. It was comfy enough to base ourselves at and feel homely, yet still smart enough to feel like we were somewhere special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Taffy000
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Adina twice both for around 3 weeks. I can only praise the whole set-up. All the staff have always been polite, helpful and respectful. We have always been happy with the apartments and service we have received. Surry Hills has great shops, restaurants and nightlife. Moores park is really near as which lead onto great walks. The city and beaches are easy to get to. Access to general transport is quick and easy. .So how some people can criticise the whole set-up and advise people to stay away is totally beyond me understanding. The write-up titled 'Beware - thieves and liars' reads like a bad novel and does not represent the Adina from my experience. We are staying there again for 2 weeks in November and looking forward to the experience. We would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Corinne0308
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Adina on Crown and highly recommend it. Staff were friendly and attentive and more than helpful. I stayed in a One Bedroom Apartment that was very comfortable and full of natural light. Great location, within walking distance to public transport, the CBD and Darling Harbour. The food next door at Bills was excellent. Have already recommended this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - but hotel needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: global_nomad_pacific
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with family. We had a two bedroom apartment. Pros. The location is very convenient, within walking distance of the city - about 15 - 20 min walk. Also close to great restaurants and a fun vibrant part of town. Bills - the restaurant downstairs is a great place for breakfast and the service at Bills is great. Cons The bathrooms were not very clean - there was black mould growing in the bathtub. Just looked like slack cleaning to me. I found the decor rather stale and depressing. The staff are not that friendly - you feel like you are staying in a youth hostel, not a hotel. Internet is not free Some rooms are very noisy due to street traffic I thought it was very expensive for the level of service and quality of hotel - but maybe that is just sydney!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE! Thieves and liars @ Adina”
Reviews.Author: Rob D
Reviews.Content: I too was part of the group that had the luggage stolen, actually it was a backpack with valuable goods. We left our luggage for no more than an hour and by time we got back there was a bag missing. The concierge had no remorse or empathy for the situation and offered little help until we got the police involved. Our bags were not left in a secured room, rather a banquet room with an unlocked door to the street which was clearly the getaway where there were no cameras. Not only did we lose luggage but we lost a day arguing to be compensated and in the end received nothing but a smile and a [--] off. Aside from this, for the 15 minutes we did spend in the room, there were bugs on the counter top in the kitchen and the showers were dirty. We were thrilled to get the hell out of this hole they call a hotel. Do not waste your money, spend a bit more and stay in a reputable place that isnt in the middle of a residential area with nothing to do.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL STOLE OUR LUGGAGE”
Reviews.Author: GirlToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: We checked into Adina Apartment in the morning and the receptionist told us our room is not ready yet but we could leave our luggage with him and walk around the city until the room was ready. We gave him 7 bags and when we returned we only received 6 bags. The hotel manager claimed that he does not know how one bag went missing and he was sorry. That's it. They did not compensate us for the lost bag even though our luggage was under their supervision. HORRIBLE HOTEL!!!!!!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE. YOUR BAG MIGHT BE STOLEN.

Reviews.Title: “NOT RUMOR- MERE FACT”
Reviews.Author: Lauren G
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 2 nights at the Adina on Crown Street with four of my friends over the New Years break. It is with great pleasure that i report that my stay was made very enjoyable. No stone was left unturned and we found our room to be ergonomically designed with comfort in mind, it was spotlessly clean and passed all of our tests! The staff were very friendly and constantly went out of their way to ensure we were satisfied! I would recommend the ADINA to anyone visiting Sydney looking for a classy yet affordable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfort and price”
Reviews.Author: liddi
Reviews.Content: For a reasonable rate you get a balcony, large, comfy bedroom, lounge, kitchen and laundry ... all in the most convenient and cool area of Sydney. Nearby are some of the best bars, restaurants, and shopping in town, walking distance to darlinghurst and a very swift cab to the CBD, funky inner-west, kings cross, paddington. And not far from the airport! Who could want for more?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: marchamona
Reviews.Content: Great position in the middle of Surrey hills bars, restaurants, shops. 5 minutes walk to Oxford street night-life. Light airy one bedroom apartment with modern furnishings. Good kitchen, tiny (narrow) balcony. Great pool area, gym, sauna. very helpful and friendly staff. Bus from almost outside to Circular Quay. Other buses from Oxford street. Will stay there again if I get to this lovely, vibrant city for another visit. We stayed over New Year, so had to pay top dollar for accommodation, but still pleased with the value considering what we saw other places were charging.

Reviews.Title: “Solid, no frills apartments”
Reviews.Author: HKGRoaming
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days in July with 6 family members and took three rooms and I agree with the other reviewers. It is clean and tidy with smart but plain looking interiors. This place is ideal for people who need a nice base to explore the city from and if you feel like staying in for a night the place is certainly nice enough to do that as well. Staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt873
Reviews.Content: The Adina offers more of a serviced apartment than hotel experience. The apartments are fitted out nicely, with a large fully-equiped kitchen and living area. Having a bedroom separate from the living area is a nice change from all-in-one hotel rooms. The apartments would be very suitable for family or long-stays. The pool area is adequate, without being outstanding. The property is located about a 5-10 minute walk from Oxford Street. Close enough to walk to the many eating places there, but far enough away to minimise the noise and bustle that goes with a 24 hour strip. My only gripe was with the bathrooms, which are basic and of a lower standard than the rest of the apartment. They are perfectly serviceable, but lack the 4.5 star finishes of the kitchen, living and sleeping areas. Overall, a solid offering in the 4 star range.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, comfortable & great location”
Reviews.Author: Colin008
Reviews.Content: We had an apartment for 2 people for a week. The location is excellent. Surry Hills is a pleasant, trendy area within easy walking distance to the town centre, Darling Harbour and Botanic Gardens etc. It is also on bus routes. Our apartment for 2 people was stylish and comfortable but could have been better equipped (cutlery and crockery provided for only 3 people meant running out of things quickly). It had a washing machine and tumble dryer in a laundry cupboard which was very useful. The hotel had a good pool, sauna, gym and barbecue area at the back. Basically, not much to complain about - a good place to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Surry Hills”
Reviews.Author: familytravel00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Adina apartments in Crown St. for 2 nights. We got a special rate directly through the hotel even though it was expensive Christmas time. We asked for the cheapest 1 bedroom but requested quite as possible apartment. We were given an apartment on the third floor which was very quiet even on Saturday night over Crown Street. Crown street has fantastic restaurants, Bills just underneath and Kawa for breakfast are fantastic so you don't want to opt for a breakfast package with the hotel. Our apartment was modern and functional with good bathroom and laundry. A grocers just a few doors away for provisions if you want to self cater. We used the parking, $25 per day but worth it to have parking in this busy area. The gym, pool spa and sauna all lovely and maintained well. Perfect Sydney pad, will return!

Reviews.Title: “Adina Surrey Hills Sydney”
Reviews.Author: techotom
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2nights at this hotel and was pleased with the apartment. The apartment was a good size, ie 2 bedrooms 2 bathrooms and decent size lounge and kitchen. We had asked for a fold up bed which wasn't there on arrival and staff had to be reminded to supply extra blankets and pillow when it had been delivered. We found a good supply of resturants and coffee shops in the vicinity, although the pub opposite was quite noisy. Would stay there again when visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Really great spot for restaurants and fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: clockworkmouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend. Friendly helpful staff, we each had our own room with balcony and bathroom. We asked for a quiet room and we got one, absolutley no rpoblem with noise. Breakfast at Bills cafe which is downstairs and also provides room service. Great facilities and much cheaper even than a twin room in a lot of sydney hotels. We ate dinner at Assiette which was a short walk away, beautiful french/australian cuisine with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps avoid Saturdays”
Reviews.Author: retiredat55
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the hotel. Facilities were generally good and staff were helpful although they messed up on booking an early morning taxi for us. Main problem was Saturday night; it is opposite a very boisterous and noisy pub where aprtying continued well into the early hours. No noise on other nights but may be best to avoid Saturdays. The location is generally convenienty for most parts of tourist Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Poor Housekeeping, Very Expensive Internet!”
Reviews.Author: msantanalopez
Reviews.Content: This is a nice apartment hotel situated in a trendy area of Sydney, Surry Hills. My only complaints, are in regards to cleaning; not very thorough and not to standards. Biggest complaint is the internet charges, the most expensive I have ever come across in any hotel in the whole planet; $25 for 24 hours (the clock starts ticking from the moment you log on, even when you are switched off, they still charge you). You can always go across the road to the convenience store for $1, but not very practical if you need to download or work. Sydney is very expensive when it comes to eating out, the apartment is great as you can cook your own stuff and saves you money. They also charge for credit card payments, so you may be better off taking cash or not using any of their services. They have a washing machine and dryer in the apartment, so this comes in very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & terrific service”
Reviews.Author: Nell214
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November 2011, in an apartment overlooking the garden. Apartment was well-equipped (including the kitchen) & the staff very helpful. Surry Hills is a great part of Sydney - a pleasant walk to the CBD & the good shopping in Woollahra - and surrounded by terrific cafes and excellent restaurants (from cheap ethnic to high end dining); much better than the central city which has few cafes or restaurants. I'll definitely return - better than any of the (many) other places I've used in Sydney. Some guests reported that rooms overlooking the road can be noisy. The only snag is the outrageously priced Internet ($A25 a day) but many of the nearby cafes have free WiFi. Don't forget to have breakfast at the branch of Bill's downstairs (no WiFi there); I recommend the fresh corn fritters! There's a lovely pool too.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish apartment in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: janie24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Adina for a 5 night stay in Sydney and then for an additional night a week later on our return to Sydney from Queensland. We had a 5th floor apartment to the side of the property, which was fairly near to the front of the building. However it was extremely quiet, despite the pubs being full with rugby celebrations. On our return for the additional night we had a 5th floor room again facing the City and it was well worth paying the price of an upgrade for the view alone. The apartments are extremely modern, well furnished and stylish but comfortable. Having the 2 bedrooms/bathrooms on either end of the apartment with the living/kitchen in the middle worked really well for us as we had my mother travelling with us as well as our 10 year old son. A real bonus was the separate laundry area with washer & dryer. The kitchen was well equipped with modern cooker, hob, microwave, fridge/freezer and a welcome dishwasher (although we didn't really use the apartment for cooking). There are lots of foodstores within 2 minutes walk and a supermarket not much further. The location is great for eating out and exploring - interesting range of cafes, restaurants and funky boutiques. Bus stops close by for buses into City or out to Bondi etc and it's only a 5 min walk to Central Station. A taxi home from the Opera House at night was less than $15. There is a lovely large swimming pool, although it is unheated and a nice jacuzzi which is heated. There is also a well equipped gym. All of the staff were extremely helpful and knowledgeable about the area. Nothing was too much trouble and they even allowed us to leave our baggage in their storeroom whilst we travelled to Queensland for 6 days so we didn't have to take everything with us. An excellent choice and very reasonably priced. We will definitely use again and will be recommending to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: chaela104
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Adina for three nights and loved it. We arrived on an early flight (around 7am) and although our room wasn't ready, the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We were able to shower and change in the swimming pool changing rooms and they took our UK mobile number to call us as soon as we could check in. To our surprise they called at 10am! We stayed in a city view apartment and from the minute we walked in, we loved it. The apartment was really modern and comfortable - with a fully equipped kitchen, dining table, large sofa seating area and a separate bedroom. It was a home away from home - and with a brilliant view of Sydney. The hotel is located in a lovely area, with lots of bars and restaurants (including Bill Granger's restaurant which is downstairs). The walk into the centre (i.e. the sky tower) only takes about 15 minutes - and its a nice walk. We happily walked all the way to the Harbour Bridge and Opera House (about a 30 minute walk). I highly recommend staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish apartment in great location”
Reviews.Author: Fiona B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Adina for a 4 night stay in Sydney (parents + 2 teenage children). We paid the upgrade for a 3rd floor, rear apartment (quieter, lighter and nice views) and (with a husband who likes to sleep with the windows open and HATES noise), that was worth it. The furnishings are stylish but comfortable. Having the 2 bedrooms/bathrooms on either end of the apartment with the living/kitchen in the middle worked really well for us, and would suit 2 couples travelling together also. Loved the separate laundry (with washer & dryer). The kitchen was well equipped with whiteware but clearly most guests don't cook as few implements, 2 blunt knives, no condiments. There are lots of foodstores within 2 minutes walk and a supermarket not much further. The location is great for eating out and exploring - interesting range of cafes, restaurants and funky boutiques. Bus stops close by for buses into City or out to Bondi etc. 5 min walk to Central Station. A taxi home from the Opera House at night was less than $15. Staff extremely helpful. Pool large but unheated. Kids used the spa though and the gym was small but well equipped. An excellent choice. Will definitely use this again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisaj67
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. Its located in a vibrant neighborhood with lots of pubs, restaurants and coffee shops on it's door step. We arrived on a Saturday evening and the room down the hall from us was obviously hosting a party. We went for dinner and I was concerned that we would have trouble getting to sleep, but when we returned to the hotel we were immediately reassured that the party had been dealt with and we didn't here any noise all night. It's a great place to stay to explore the rest of the city. You can walk to the central train station in about 10 mins and catch trains or buses from there or continue walking (you can get to the opera house in about 30mins walk) There is a free bus (the 555) that you can catch from the station that travels down Elizabeth street to circular quay. Great for when your feet get tired.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT place to stay in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: hilaryw
Reviews.Content: This apartment hotel is centrally located in groovy Crown St, surrounded by some interesting shops and great bars and restaurants. Bill's (famous Ozzie chef Bill Granger) is just downstairs for the best breakfasts, lunches and dinners! The hotel is very friendly with helpful staff and the rooms are extremely comfortable and well appointed. All are suites with living room, separate bedroom (both with TVs), bathroom with bath and shower, washing machine and dryer and a kitchen! Everything you could possibly need. An easy walk to the (excellent) shops of Oxford St and another easy walk to the City. I recommend this as an excellent option for visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Just About Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Shangel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night...check in was smooth and very welcoming...Our apartment (one bedroom) was just lovely...clean, spacious, gorgeous view, and very accommodating...it could not be faulted. The rate we paid was very, very good. Unfortunately on check out we had some problems...payment and a deposit were put on hold in our card at check in (debit card) then on check out payment was taken again...because we had the exact amount for our stay in this card... our payment was declined (because it was on hold...which incidentally took five days to return to our account)...It was such a big shambles, we had to leave our bags there....sort things out with the bank (via phone because it was Bank Holiday)...and then go back and pay....That incident kind of soured our stay although the staff were very gracious during the whole incident. Next time I have learned...use the credit card! No worries then.

Reviews.Title: “Bigger than I thought good layout”
Reviews.Author: Theresablondeinmybed
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room with friends with two double beds, there was a huge mirror opposite the bathroom which was great as we had 4 girls doing their makeup for a night out. Great location, quiet, lifts and convenient car parking.

Reviews.Title: “exactly what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: aedavies101
Reviews.Content: Our apartment was clean and spacious, the service efficient and friendly.We also loved the Surry Hills location. Initialy we were looking for accomodation more centrally, however we loved this area; lots of interesting cafes and being big fans of the Belvoir Theatre this was ideal. A short walk to Central Station opened up the rest of Sydney too. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent option”
Reviews.Author: Marv1nM
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our week long stay at the Adina in Sydney. Check-in was painless. The rooms were spacious and we liked the modern dÃ©cor. The facilities in the unit were excellent, even including a washer, dryer and dishwasher. The kitchen was stocked with a bar supply but no condiments like salt, pepper or oil, which we found odd. We were also missing a frying pan but the staff soon corrected that. Our one bedroom had a decent-sized balcony that we made good use of. The only major shortcoming here was the cost of in-room internet, which was expensive ($12 per hour/$100 per week). There was a kiosk near the lobby where you could get it at $2 per 20 minutes. Newspapers are delivered to your door on request and for a charge. They have a large hot tub but the outdoor pool was not heated so it was unusable in the winter. The provide gas BBQs outside and an eating area for the guests to use. Ask at the desk for the bin of tools, disposable dishes and cutlery for al fresco dining. Staff were uniformly excellent, with several going out of their way to be helpful. The neighbourhood was also fun, with several friendly pubs and eateries. We enjoyed visiting the numerous small food stores, bottle shops and delis in the area to stock up on supplies. Chinatown and the Australian museum are nearby, however a walk to the waterfront at Circular Quay would be a bit of a trek. Central Station is only a few hundred meters away and we used it to get tour buses and trains to our destinations. It can be a little noisy, especially on Friday and Saturday nights, but this is to be expected in an area like this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment, good location, shame about the little things”
Reviews.Author: Malkied1
Reviews.Content: The Apartment iteself was great. Included Dishwasher, Washing Machine / Tumble Dryer, etc. Sadly though there was no hairdryer, and no remote control for the main TV meaning that it wouldn't work, and despite the massive wardrobe there were only 4 hangers. Service was slow, and my pre-visit emails enquiring about transportation and tours were not responded too. If they could sort the little things then this would be awesome. Crown Street area is great for nightlife and things to do.

Reviews.Title: “great option for a visit to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: CassGeorge
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Adina whilst our house was being renovated. We live in the inner west of Sydney and we loved the location of the Adina. It is walking distance into the city and in a fantastic area for restaurants, bars, pubs and interesting shops. Bills is right downstairs and rightly famous for its breakfasts, although dinner is also excellent. The apartments are spacious and comfortable, with a good size kitchen that has basic equipment - which is all you probably need given the eating options just outside the door. I would highly recommend the Adina for visitors to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, top apartment!”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyPortmacquarie
Reviews.Content: A group of 8 stayed here recently and it could not have been better! the rooms are fabulous, very well equipped kitchens. The staff are super friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic...so many cafes and quaint shops and eateries around and a short walk to all city areas. It is really great to stay in this area rather than city centre/ Darling harbour area. No complaints at all and very satisfied!!..except the parking would be nice if it was included!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: midwicket
Reviews.Content: The Adina is a really good apartment hotel in a nice area of Surry Hills. The apartments are spacious and well fitted out. I don't agree with the charge for laundry powder. No other hotel charges for it in an apartment. Kitchen is great, but lacks a few crockery pieces. All rooms have separate air conditioners. Parking can be painful as it has limited space underneath. There is a supermarket within 500 metres, so stocking up the kitchen is very easy. There are countless restaurants and cafes in the area. It is a nice mix of inner city and suburbia.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved”
Reviews.Author: Haze95
Reviews.Content: Only stayed the one night in a one bedroom but were very impressed. We have stayed here previously when was the medina and were very unimpressed but now great revamp, good staff, location & facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great rooms , Great Space”
Reviews.Author: FatherDownUnder
Reviews.Content: 1BR apartment - 2nd floor facing Crown St Surry Hills is a bustling community of cafes & bars just on the doorstep to the famous Oxford street strip of Bars , Clubs & nightlife (mainly Gay, but some hetro offerings too) . It is also a great location to explore the city from as it is reasonably close & easily accessible via regular public transport. This apartment would be great for someone looking for an extended stay & requiring the home comforts of your own kitchen & laundry facilities. Nice Apt very clean , large separate living / dining / working area Good sized kitchen - Oven , stove top , Microwave & Dishwasher bar fridge variety of stock beers / soft drinks & snacks at reasonable rates but hotel is so close to all the shops & grocery stores in Surry Hills that you could easily stock up at a cheaper rate. separate Bedroom Clean & Comforatble with full length mirror on huge built in wardrobes (safe in wardrobe) variable Air con in lounge & separate variable unit in Bedroom Compact bathroom but clean , with a washing machine & dryer tucked away in a cupboard 26â€� Flatscreen TV in lounge 23â€� Flatscreen wallmounted TV in Bedroom Crown street traffic a bit noisy especially buses Hotel was sold at $200 but extra 1.5% surcharge for ALL credit card payments Under hotel parking $25 Internet $12.50 for 1 hour or $24.95 for 24 Hours Situated above the fabulous Bills restaurant , with fantastic breakfasts , Specialities include - Ricotta pancakes & Corn fritters hotel facilities include Pool , spa, Sauna Gym & BBQ area

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large rooms.”
Reviews.Author: dancemonkey
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Sydney. The location is absolutely perfect, right in the heart of Surry Hills, with greta restaurants and bars right on your doorstep. The rooms are very generous in size and having a serviced apartment is a good option. The decor was starting to look a little tired and free wifi would be a nice service to add.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and good service”
Reviews.Author: DrEckord
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Everything was excellent and the staff were very helpful. We had some problems with the card keys but otherwise no problem. We walked from here to Sydney cbd in 15 mins Bills restaurant on ground floor was great.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Soconnell74
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, the room was nice and the staff very friendly. I'd certainly recommend the hotel and don't really have any serious complaints. As has been noted in other reviews, Internet access is priced crazily (I've never seen prices so high) but I'd recommend buying a prepaid USB modem - I bought a vodaphone modem at Woolworths with 3GB of data for $30 which covered me for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrettylnPink
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here as everything was very well taken care of, clean and quite. Views are attractive and nice big windows to enjoy them. The hotel is also in a wonderful location close to restaurants and attractions. Staff was polite and made special accommodations for us when we needed them. Overall, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room in Beautiful Surry Hills”
Reviews.Author: ereg11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adina for 3 nights from a Tuesday to a Friday (AM) recently and I have to say that it was absolutely perfect for our requirements. I stayed there with my partner and his parents in the two bedroom apartments on level 4. The room was spacious, clean and most of all had two bathrooms! Perfect for sharing with future in laws! It had a fully equipped kitchen, dishwasher, washing machine, microwave the works and this boded very well with the oldies! It was $900 for the 3 nights but the location was ideal was it was only a ten min walk (if even) to central station. It was my first time in Sydney and I wanted to make it a special trip for my partners parents as they made the long trip to Oz from Ireland. The Adina definitely scored me brownie points on the future daughter in law card! Thank you! If I had to say something bad thing about the hotel is that it has a 'business conference' atmos to it and the pool is outdoors, too chilly in May. It was also a little noisy from the street as our room faced Crown St. However, it was just a base for us to lay our heads and the location was great. PS. took a trip to the Blue Mountains and it was amazing also took slow ferry to Manly Beach and these were perfect for the older generation, not to mention seeing the Opera House and Harbour Bridge (didn't do the bridge climb though- decided that I didn't want to kill them all together! lol)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gav-AUS
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a good location. Only complaints were that the TV is tuned with the volume so low by the hotel's TV system that you can't hear them, and that the beds felt like they were collapsing when you sat on them - like the inside of the matteress had disintegrated!

Reviews.Title: “Roomy hotel”
Reviews.Author: NZdad
Reviews.Content: This hotel had good size rooms, a good size outdoor pool and a nice relaxed feeling. Food was exceptionally good at Bills downstairs, even if the waitstaff were a little to cool for us mere mortals. And the only big downside - Internet access was $25 per day. But then this is standard for most hotels in Sydney! I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Adina Apartments Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurakoopmans
Reviews.Content: In the heart of gorgeous Surry Hills, Adina apartment hotel is located on Crown Street in the midst of trendy cafe's and restaurants and a whole range of funky shops. We arrived at Adina on a Saturday afternoon and checked in to a gorgeous spacious 2 bed, 2 bathroom apartment on the fourth level with its best feature being a huge private tiled terrace overlooking the city; amazing!! Adina's staff and management were wonderful, attentive, very helpful and flexible; the apartments are modern, clean, spacious and airconditioned and the pool and spa area is private, clean and comfortable . All in all we had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Really handy location and excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Gaslight
Reviews.Content: Travelled to sydney from the north coast to go to an event in the city. The Adina was an excellent choice, close to town and in the heart of the trendy surrey hills with everything you need just around the corner. The room was amazing and had a great view over the back of the city. Really easy acces to transport to the city and the staff were really helpful (even lending me a phone charger!) would highly recommend this place ... great value.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, great location, good value!”
Reviews.Author: vancityexpat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Feb 9th. Check-in didn't take long, and service was friendly. Lifts were aged but worked fine. Apartment was clean, and bigger than expected. Well used rooms, but not tatty. Parking was secure, However 4wd barely fit going around corners. Close to heaps of trendy restaurants. great value for money, will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JodesLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Adina over Christmas, with 2 young children and thought it was exceptional value. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful- responding graciously to all requests. The location was fantastic - having lived at Surry Hills a long time ago - I was pleasantly surprised by the addition of gourmet butcher and a number of great grocers along Crown St, and within 150-200 metres of the Adina. It is handy to a lovely park with playground also in close walking distance and some absolutely amazing restaurants of varying costs. You can also get great coffee and room service from Bills downstairs (as well as a great 'home' delivery selection from Moving Menus). The area still continues to have its odd crazy person and druggo, but to me they seem harmless and are counterbalanced by a diverse mix of families, young creative types, older professionals etc who either call Surry Hills home or they place they like to be. The apt was great- we stayed in a 2 bedroom unit on the 4th floor facing Crown St (I wouldn't want to be lower- as you probably would get too much traffic noise and wouldnt get the great views). It was very well appointed, with 2 bathrooms, nicely sized living area and kitchen, air conditioning, openable windows, spacious bedrooms, laundry and excellent storage. We didn't get to use the pool etc- but it certainly did look a lovely pool. My only quibble would be that housekeeping was a bit slack- although the rooms were serviced- other than the making of beds and new towels when requested, there usually wouldn't be vacuuming or wiping down mirrors, amongst other things, each day. I also think they need new doonas, which seemed very very tired when you looked under the covers (we thankfully didn't really use because it was warm)- but I would not hesitate in recommending the Adina otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious, comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: PaulTheMajor
Reviews.Content: These apartments were excellent, and the area is good for food and bars; it's less than 10 minutes walk to the trains at Central Station, and local bus services take you quickly into the city centre and Circular Quay. The apartments appeared reasonably clean, however, the poor state of the toilet brushes suggest the cleaning is superficial only. Our 2-bedroom unit was large and spacious, great for hanging out, eating take-aways and watching movies. What appeared to be a well-stocked "Welcome Pack" on the worktop, which included a bottle of wine, was in fact an extension of the minibar; luckily we realised that before tucking into some of the goodies! While the Reception staff were very pleasant, they seemed to have no information on the local bus services or on local restaurants. Crown Street has many good restaurants within a 10 minute stroll from the apartments (Tabou was superb, Pizza e Birra also very good, Bill's - next door - do a HUGE and tasty breakfast, while the Dolphin hotel was not so good). Internet access at Adina is very, very expensive, about 13 dollars per hour, and what we did was use one of 2 PCs in Reception where the charges were 6 dollars per hour, but with a minimum of 10 mins @ 1 dollar we could keep the cost of checking emails, etc., down. Most European hotels view wireless internet access in the same category as hot water, electricity, pillows - essential and free! Why do Ozzie hotels charge so much for what is now an important part of the overall package?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Style”
Reviews.Author: JethroCanberra
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before when it was Medina on Crown and I was pleased to see that it had only got better. I stay here because of the great location. It is surrounded by great cafes, resturants, wine bars and pubs and its an easy walk into paddington, if you like a good walk! The apartments have beee tastefully refurbished, they are spacious, well equipped and are great value when you consider the options in the area. The staff were very friendly and helpful and this has generally been my experience there before. I think its a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Apartment offers so much more than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelAtPerth
Reviews.Content: The family and I stayed at the Adina Apartments for 4 days in late June. The apartment was much better than the Sydney weather and we were thankful to have the use of the washing machine and the tumble dryer to dry our clothes on 2 occasions. We faced onto a small side street (looking towards Redfern) and although the view wasn't great we didn't experience any noise issues that had been described in other reviews, however I had requested a quiet room when I did the online booking. I really liked the size of the apartment which was very spacious, especially the bedrooms and central living area. The master bedroom lacked a TV which was not a problem. There were 2 bathrooms, one with a bath/shower, the other with a shower. The bathrooms showed some signs of wear and tear, but the general condition of the apartment was very good. The apartment was excellent value at the price of a hotel room closer to the city. Once we figured out how to walk to the central station (about 10 minutes walk) we could explore Sydney easily. The Sydney daily transport passes was great value for the family at $20/adult, $10/child with the other child traveling for free. The kitchen crockery and cutlery was limited and I certainly wouldn't try and cooking anything more complicated than pancakes (which we did on 2 occasions). I am sure the staff would have reacted well to any request for additional kitchen utensils if needed. When we needed to have the hair dryer replaced (after it started smoking!) the staff reacted very positively and promptly to our request. Surry Hills (particularly along Oxford Street) had a redlight district feel which I hadn't expected and I felt uncomfortable, yet safe, when we took the family down along Oxford Street on our first evening. After that we avoided the area by using the Central Station. If I had one complaint it was that the Internet was a rip-off at $25/day. I was able to use free internet at the Surry Hills library which was a block away, but could not get my VPN to work, so I forked out the $25 on one day. All in all a great apartment, but a little bit out of the â€œactionâ€� area of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Convient but dodgy billing system”
Reviews.Author: Avalon2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few friends and it was perfect. Great location, nice amenities and it was cheap as I booked it on booking.com. There were a few little glitches, like them forgetting to clean our rooms and re-stocking things but that is pretty minor. It is right in the midst of all the nice cafes and shops in Surry Hills. BUT I booked this place online as I mentioned and they authorised my debit card about 24 hours before. Then they took a $100 bond by 'holding' the fund again on my debit card. So it works out they freeze the intial authorisation amiunt and they charged me again for the 3 nights accomodation ($620). I had $1200 missing from my account because they refund the authorisation amunt which can take up to 5 working days. They didnt tell me about this and I wonder if it is illegal or not. So in other words BEWARE. Maybe its different if you book directly with them im not sure. The staff are a little difficult to deal with as only one person seems to know what they are doing. Other than that the 2 bedroom weekend away was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, comfortable stay - recommend this one”
Reviews.Author: leggygal
Reviews.Content: Want a spacious apartment close to some of Sydney's finest dining experiences - well you've come to the right place. Comfortable bed - check, ultra reasonable rates through their website - check - absolutely no hassles - check. All in all a comfortable night's stay. Did get a bit of noise during the night, but to be expected in such a midcity locale - certainly nothing unbearable. The furnishings are beginning to show a little sign of wear and tear but that's to be expected and everything was certainly functioning, smart and clean. The kitchen was larger than you would expect in a lot of modern apartments which would have been fantastic for a longer stay. Didn't have time to check out the leisure facilities so not sure what they were like.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to see Sydney with young children”
Reviews.Author: travelerinva801
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Medina on Crown. The two bedroom setup worked very well for our family with 2 small children - we like to be able to stay up and do things like prepare for the next days' sightseeing after the children are asleep. The neighborhood was great. Very convenient to grocery stores, the train station, and restaurants. The Bills 2 restaurant located on the ground floor was excellent - I wish we could have eaten there more often! They were very accomodating to the kids and for takeaway. We also enjoyed easy access to the city's excellent bus system as we did not have a rental car for most of our stay. I wish there were just a few more amenities in the kitchen such as extra paper towels - i think there was just one dishtowel and once it got wet we were out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: SydneySunchaser
Reviews.Content: Great location, plenty of cafes, pubs, and great restaurants within walking distance. Very clean and modern rooms, excellent and helpful staff. Huge outdoor swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: rosstibetan
Reviews.Content: if you want to fall out of bed into the buzzy vibe any number of great cafes and restaurants, this is the perfect location. It's a great central location with very convenient transport links and walking distance to many attractions. The hotel rooms are great value with all the facilities of an apartment. The design is stylish and the place well maintained. I had slight concerns about how quiet the hotel would be considering our room faced onto Crown Street but it was fine even over new year's eve. Frankly, having also stayed at Blue at Woolloomoolloo, I found the rooms and location there to be less attractive at twice the price. Medina, great value for money. Tip: keep checking the room rate direct with the hotel, you often find that last minute the room rate drops dramatically and isn't necessarily posted on their booking site.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault but with free internet would be even better”
Reviews.Author: higvin
Reviews.Content: We agree with all the very positive earlier reviews. Excellent combination of good central location, spacious serviced apartments and reasonable rates compared to what you'd be paying for the equivalent in other great cities (in London you pay double for something roughly equivalent, e.g. Chelsea Apartments on Draycott Place). Good bathrooms, kitchen and air conditioning and there's also guest parking underneath. The excellent outdoor pool is another bonus. We arrived off an international flight several hours before our room was ready and staff were very accommodating about our using the pool until our apartment was ready. Free internet would make Medina Serviced Apartments unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bellgra
Reviews.Content: Close to great restaurants (Marque, bills, billy kwong in the same building), multitude of great restaurants nearby. Close to central, oxford st, cricket ground/football stadium, 15 minute bus ride to city/circular quay. Hotel looks to have been recently renovated, good sized rooms, comfortable beds, clean and modern . Pool was a good size with a nice courtyard with bbq facilities. Parking is reasonable at $15 a day. Negatives, we had one of our toilets (we had 2) out of order which wasn't fixed during the stay despite us notifying them of it.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again (...wish we could have stayed longer!)”
Reviews.Author: Chiquita_999
Reviews.Content: As two couples travelling together, we were after a nice, not overly expensive place to stay from where we could relax and easily see Sydney. We were lucky enough to find rooms at this hotel for a good price online (worked out to $100 a night per couple including parking). The rooms looked good in photos, but when we got there we were surprised that they were everything and more than they appeared in the pictures! Our one-bedroom apartments had plenty of space, a nice long lounge, full kitchen facilities, dining table which comfortably sits four people, bathroom (with bath!), large bed and wardrobe with a safe, individual balcony and even a laundry. Though we didn't get around to using them, there's also a BBQ, gym, pool, spa and sauna at the hotel. A few people have commented on the lifts and noise. We didn't find a problem with either. The only noise we really heard was an occasional ambulance at night along the Crown St side as there's a hospital nearby. It's not far from the city; only a 5-10 min walk from Central Station, and it's easy to catch taxis and buses from out front of the hotel. The staff were nice and helpful with not only our stay at the hotel but also suggesting places to eat and how to get around the city, providing maps to help us get around. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would definitely stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: valmae
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed at Medina on Crown for some time and I wasn't disappointed. The apartments have been refurbished in the last couple of years and are very modern and clean. The public areas are modern and the place has a great feel. The pool is large and the hotel staff were very accommodating - we couldn't work the heating or find an iron and they responded immediately to our requests. I tip is to request a room on the Fitzroy Street side of the building - they are quieter than the Crown Street rooms

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Medina On Crown”
Reviews.Author: teresavimini
Reviews.Content: Being right in the middle of Surry Hills, it's a cool inner city spot full of too cool for school locals, cafes, restaurants, bars, clubs and funky designer boutiques. Spacious accommodation- bedroom was huge, with very comfy bed. I slept like a log and it was so quiet considering location is in one of Sydneyâ€™s night life precincts. Kitchen was great, has everything you may need, coffee maker, oven, microwave, pots pans, itâ€™s all there. Itâ€™s great to be able to make coffee or cook if you want. All mod cons included so that you can really chill and feel like you are home away from home. CD player, 2 LCD TV's, one in lounge and one in bedroom. Bathroom was quite big, with bath. The hotel has absolutely the best million dollar views from the balconies, of the Sydney City Skyline. Make sure you ask for one of the rooms overlooking the courtyard with a balcony, (quieter than the street facing rooms and offers the views-slightly more expensive) mine was room 615. Big thanks to Jonathon the duty manager for taking care of my reservation, and special mention to Denny @ reception who is an assett to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: SFscott413
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Medina on Crown! It's centrally located to so many things in Sydney, but seems to be a hub of great restaurants and boutique shops. We absolutely loved the location. I am so glad we went with the serviced apartments (vs. standard hotel) because it made the trip seem more homey and allowed us to eat breakfast in as well as do our laundry. Very modern decor, great staff, and nice jacuzzi. The only complaint was the cleaning person wasn't too attentive: we had crumbs on our table our entire stay - or at least until my partner cleaned them up himself.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite in Sydney. Tres Chic!”
Reviews.Author: bronte88
Reviews.Content: I cannot begin to even descirbe how much I adore this hotel. I have stayed at this hotel over 4 times, for a night out, a place to stay after music festivals and when I have to fly out the next day for buisness. It is located smack bang in the middle of the trendiest part of Sydney surrounded by chic bars, restaurants and small boutiques. A 5 min down the road will lead to the retail oasis that is Oxford St. The rooms at this place are stunning. They have recently been re-furbised the whole place, the first time I stayed there they were vamping up the reception and I could hardly hear what the receptionist was saying. However this loud noise did not in any way affect my stay. We paid for a one bedroom then were upgraded to a 2 bedroom! (It was only my boyfriend and I). These places are gorgeous! 2 double bedrooms both with LCD ands a chic kitchen and lounge room which sprawls out onto a massive patio. I felt like calling all my friends for a party! However, the other times we have stayed there we have stayed in a 1 bedroom, a couple of times were havent had a patio/deck as some of the apartments as designed differently to others. Some are very open planed with a large deck/patio and some are very narrow with no deck at all. Central station is about a 10 min walk (you can then catch a train to Town Hall, Circular Quay etc), however if you are walking from the station to the hotel be prepared to burn some calories as its uphill. The breakfast in their restaurant is simple and light, and the coffee and service was excellent. I highly recommend this hotel! Its spacious, it doesn't feel like a hotel but has all the service aswell as having alot of privacy and its quiet. The only thing worth complaining about is how slow the lifts are but they are getting re-done anyway. Definately returning again... !

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: od6600
Reviews.Content: Great location as it's walkable (20mins-ish) into the CBD and all the other tourist spots in Sydney. In the evenings you're slap in the middle of the trendiest bars and restaurants in Sydney too. The main problem is that it's a little noisy at night so its probably best for those planning to be out being part of the nighhtlife rather than sleeping off jetlag; double glazing might have helped. Although the kitchen looks clean and well equiped there's a paucity of pots and pans that really limits you to little more than heating up a tin of soup; a real shame given the outstanding butcher just across the road. Again it's probably a hotel aimed at people more likely to be enjoying the local restaurants rather than eating in.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney experience”
Reviews.Author: DandC08
Reviews.Content: D&C from Lampeter Wales The Medina on Crown was recommended to us as a good base to stay in Surrey Hills close to where our son lives in Sydney. We were a little concerned having read mixed reports/reviews about the hotel on trip advisor. Any doubts we had very quickly disappeared as we were met by very friendly and helpful staff (this continued throuhout our stay), the refurbishment of the hotel had been completed and our room exceeded our expectations. the only slight disappointment was that we (upon recommendation requested a garden/pool view room) were allocated a room overlooking Crown street which was a little noisey until midnight and again about 7.30am. That said the hotel's location to many excellent restaurants and bars in Crown Street more than compensated for this minor disappointment. Well done to everyone at the hotel for making our stay a very pleasent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - great apartment”
Reviews.Author: Hay72
Reviews.Content: Travelled as a family with young childen over Christmas 2007 in a HUGE 2 bedroomed, 2 bathroomed, 3 LCD TV suite. When we first arrived in the early evening, the first impression of the Medina on Crown was very good. The reception staff were friendly and efficient and check-in process went smoothly. The apartment on the second floor was surprisingly large and well equipped and had obviously been recently refurbished to a high standard with new beds. Bathrooms appeared to have been refurbished to and were a decent size. The laundry in the apartment with large washing machine and tumble drier is very useful, making this apartment block ideal for longer stays with the family, The housekeeping was excellent, and they even put the dishwasher on or emptied it if we had forgotten to! Location was good in Surry Hills, Crown Street being on a main bus route to Circular Quay and a 15 minute walk to Darling Harbour. There is a Woolworths 1 block away and a Coles Supermarket a little further away in the centre of Surry Hills. The Central Station is less than 10 minutes walk away. There is a nice swimming pool and a very hot, hot tub! The gym seemed well equipped and when we were there was rarely busy. Overall a very good location and comfortable alternative to a hotel room with the additional facilities allowing self catering together with being close to Sydney's Central Business District and tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless!”
Reviews.Author: benSA
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of its location and managed to get a ridiculously cheap deal on lastminute.com.au The previous reviews thought it was fairly good. Managed to get a 1 bedroom apartment for $125 per night which I dont think I need to tell you is extremely cheap for sydney. Arrived at 12 noon - was told room was not ready (fair enough - check in is at 2pm), but they took care of our bags. They rang me an hour later to say the room was ready (an hour early!), and when we got back to the hotel they had taken our bags up already (was VERY impressed with a little touch like that!). Apartment was a good size - nice view from the balcony - bed extremely comfy. Bathroom was very nice - kitchen a little dated, but didn't need to use it (hires a 1 bedroom for the size, not the facitilities.). Staff were very friendly - housekeeping was efficient. Rained the entire weekend but that was really the only downer! Would definetely stay there again - its an awesome location if you want to be close to Oxford St - (5 min walk) and it is very, very good value in an otherwise pretty expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Be wary”
Reviews.Author: potaroo
Reviews.Content: Appartment was fair value for the money if a little tired regarding the contents. Refrigerator required maintenance to refix part of the casing and there were insufficient items of crockery - 2 wine glasses and 3 beakers seems an odd amount for a 4 person appartment. One of the most annoying things any traveller has to put up with is no plug in the bathroom. Although maintenance supplied a plug quickly it was the wrong size!! Having read other comments regarding the hotel we requested that the mini-bar contents were removed at check in, then again in the evening and again the following morning. They were still there at the end of our stay. Despite a notice on the balcony doors regarding security and locking the doors when leaving the room, no key was provided for the main balcony entry door into the appartment. We requested this but were told that there was only 1 key available for the entire block and if we wanted the door locked then they would have to send someone up to lock/unlock each time. This may have been as a result of a suicide from a 3rd floor appartment just prior to our stay. Sometime in the early hours of our final night, a letter was pushed under our appartment door reminding us of our departure time and stating that our final account was attached. No it wasn't. We queried this on checkout and were told that we could not have a print out of the final account because we "had booked through Rates-to-go and therefore had the paperwork"?? Although the staff seemed helpful, one got the feeling that they were sometimes uncomfortable at carrying out the company policies.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: Risky_Rat
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one bedroom apartment, and had booked for a Friday and Saturday night. The check-in was fine, staff were friendly enough. When I walked into my room, though, I knew that things would be tricky. I am a relatively light sleeper, and the windows faced on to very busy Crown St. The windows were not double-glazed, so the noise, even during the day, was very loud. I asked reception if I could be moved to a room on the other side of the hotel (the quieter side), but was told they were fully booked. When I tried to get to sleep around 11pm, I climbed into bed, and discovered that my 'Queen" sized bed, was actually two half single beds, pushed together. One of the beds was higher than the other, and the beds were close to solid - I have slept in some pretty hard beds, but these were the hardest that I have ever endured. The noise from the street was incredible, and I still hadn't gotten to sleep by 3.30am. I decided that I would book another hotel, online, at that time, and checked out the next day (even though I had another night booked). The staff told me that I was entitled to a refund, but I couldn't bear another night with all the noise, and the incredibly uncomfortable bed. I moved to The Grace hotel, in the city, and had the most wonderful night's sleep. PS. I had stayed at the Medina on Crown, quite regularly, in the late 90s. It seems that not a lot has changed in this time, and in terms of competition, at this price, I think you should really consider staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great, comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lgrb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in March 2007. A very comfortable alternative to a hotel and excellent value for money given the size of the apartment ($200 per night). We stayed in a two bedroom apartment which was spacious with a large kitchen, living room (including dining area), two bathrooms and laundry facilities. The apartment is nicely decorated without being too fancy. Some parts of the apartment were starting to show their age (eg shower screen in 1 bathroom did not close). Overall the apartment had everything you could want. The location is great as you have plenty of restaurants and cafes within a short stroll. The fantastic Blls cafe is downstairs and is a fantastic place for breakfast/brunch. You have to try the ricotta hot cakes with fresh bananna and honeycomb butter. They are to die for. - as are the eggs and most other items on the menu. Dinner and lunch is also great. The fantastic Billy Kwong is also close by. In my opinon this the best chinese food in the city (have lived in Sydney all my life so have been to many restaurants). Overall highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed; a bargain over New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: uajamesh
Reviews.Content: Nice big, new rooms with good views over south of city and Anzac Bridge (we were on the third floor facing into the courtyard). Clean new, good bathrooms. Nice pool, jacuzzi and smallish gym. (the rooms also seem to have daily maid service which is a bonus!) Location great for cricket, but its about a 30min walk to the harbour and Circular Quay. Just opposite is a trendy new gastro pub type place - but noise not an issue; next door is "Bill's" a trendy eaterie from Bill Granger and next to the bar is an internet cafe that's open from 7-midnight and charges A$3 per hour. Plus a big supermarket is 2 blocks away. Kitchen is well stocked with plates etc. All in all, we were very impresed and would definitely go back - but if you want to spend all your days at the beach it is a bit of a walk to the harbour...

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Flin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a great city view (which was fantastic) serviced apartment from Dec 31 until 7 Jan 07. Rooms were ok value wise given the time of year - I upgraded the room and they forgot to charge me for it so this slightly improved this aspect. Apartment was really spacious with large double bed and walk in closset which my fiancee was very excited about. Can't complain about anything in the room apart from the lack of Fox which was a slight dissapointment given the 'Executive' badge. Pool area is good with a spacious BBQ area also attached. Location is good is you want to walk to Aussie stadium or the SCG which are 10 mins away. The city centre is 30 mins walk or A$10 in a taxi. Lots of good restaurants around including Bills next door. Overall a great place to stay just slightly away from the centre which would be very appealing to families. Just one further note however - the grass roof top tennis court is not open!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: john383811
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay for a couple of days. The rooms are spacious and the balconies have excellent views. Location is OK - although there is a Salvation Army centre about 10m from the hotel and walking late at night was a bit intimidating especially since on both occasions, we were asked for 'change' with a rather aggressive tone from drunk youths. We werent too happy with the airconditioning initially as it was a rather old unit and every time it was turned on, it gave off a weird smell however we eventually got used to it.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, bargain!”
Reviews.Author: GTinNZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night after flying long-haul into Sydney, following a recommendation from a mate. Room rate was AUD100 for a double room, and the apartment we got was huge!! 2 large bedrooms, 2 large bathrooms and a great kitchen / lounge area. Definitely better value for money than staying centrally. Great restaurant next door too!

Reviews.Title: “Staff disgraceful”
Reviews.Author: Grumpy23
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is perfectly fine. The rude and unhelpful staff are the reason I will never stay at this hotel again. On check-in I was assigned a room that was not only not what I booked, but also filthy - it had not yet been serviced. On returning downstairs they took the keys back and then explained they did not have the room that I booked available. They then took 2 hours to have the room cleaned. They then offered to put in a rollaway bed to make the room more to my requirements, but then insisted I would have to pay $30 to cover it - when it was their mistake in the first place! During my time in the lobby three other guests came down to complain about their rooms - one guest had even been given a key for a room to walk in and find another guest in there. The staff dealt with all complaints in an extremely rude manner, and continued with their sour service right up to checkout. I even wrote a letter of complaint outlining my problems and didn't even receive a response. I rarely complain about hotels but this is the worst staff I have ever come across and it brings the otherwise nice rooms down. Stay here if you want rude service and be made to feel unwelcome.

HotelInfo.Name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney, Crown Street
HotelInfo.Address: 359 Crown Street, Surry Hills, Sydney, New South Wales 2010, Australia
